alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 7:31AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Breezy and blustery conditions into the weekend... Breezy conditions will continue across the area with the higher elevations of the Nulato Hills and areas along the Norton Sound Coast seeing the strongest winds. Winds will be northeast at 20 to 30 mph and gusty in the Nulato Hills and the Norton Sound Coast, and northeast 10 to 15 mph in the Upper Kuskokwim, and Middle and Lower Yukon Valleys through Saturday. Winds will diminish along the Norton Sound Coast and in the Nulato Hills to 15 to 25 mph Saturday night. Temperatures will range from the teens during the day to single digits below overnight. Wind Chill will range from around 20 below at night to around zero during the day. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta
